reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed to find a hotel at the last minute in Missoula, and most other cheaper hotels were all booked so we stayed here thinking it's a bit pricy for a hotel in Missoula, MT.
reviews.title: Super Clean Hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed at many Courtyard brand hotels before, but this one was seems to be one of the cleanest I've stayed. We had two queen beds, and it came with a rather large bathroom, with was super clean. The front desk personnel was nice, and offered us warm cookies. (They were very good!) It had a decent fitness room, and a small indoor pool.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff, warm cookies.

reviews.text: I don't know if I'll stay here again if other cheaper and trusty brand like Hampton Inn is available, but I'll strongly consider this place as one of the choices.
reviews.title: Great Room and Location
Clean Rooms, Not Well Insulated
reviews.text: There are lots of hotels to choose from in Missoula. The Courtyard is a little bit more expensive than some, but very nice and well worth a little extra money. The staff was friendly, the lobby is very nice, and the room was very clean. We had a suite with a separate bedroom, which was very big. They do have an elevator which was important to us because we had a lot of luggage. And the best part was the apples and warm cookies at the reception desk!
